### What is expected?
I want to mount a component programmatically inside the same App that will use my plugin

Issues.Title: A medium level way to use components
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
We are front-end developers and we don't need to be worried about data and stuff.
What about having a medium level and use components for development only and then build pure html, css and js?
Then our only concern is the front-end itself, not anything else
and if vue has this feature let me know please: dania99.dev@gmail.com

### What does the proposed API look like?
before build:

```
mainDir
|- Assets
|- Components
|    |_ .vue file 1
|    |_ .vue file 2
|    |_ .vue file 3
|
|- index.html
|- main.js
```

after build:

```
mainDir
|- dist
    |_ images
    |_ css
    |_ js
    |
    |-index.html (all the components are bundled here)
```
something like this

Issues.Title: `.once` modifier on input event prevents v-model from updating value on input element.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/fxdez9qh/](https://jsfiddle.net/fxdez9qh/)







### Steps to reproduce
Type some text in the input field.

### What is expected?
The input handler is executed and the value in the input is updated.

### What is actually happening?
The input handler is executed but the first update to the model is not applied. This means the first character typed will not show up.

---
I found this issue: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/6552 It's a few years old and it was fixed but it seems to be the same problem.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`.once` modifier on input event prevents v-model from updating value on input element." (#11925)

Issues.Title: Number -0 cannot be correctly rendered in input :value
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/yuchaosydney/pen/xxRgEPP](https://codepen.io/yuchaosydney/pen/xxRgEPP)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Open reproduction link
2. Compare display value from input tag rendered by Vue and plain input html tag

### What is expected?
Input dom should correctly render value -0

### What is actually happening?
It renders as 0

---
In javascript, Number `-0` is legitimate value, this can be verified by checking `Number(-0) === -0`. Therefore, when input `:value` is number `-0`, input tag should correctly display it, just as a plain input html tag does.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Number -0 cannot be correctly rendered in input :value" (#11909)

Issues.Title: camelCase properties are not converted to kebab-case when using `v-bind="{ }"` object syntax on a native element
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/sh0ber/cqo7yjex/](https://jsfiddle.net/sh0ber/cqo7yjex/) ### Steps to reproduce 1. Use the `v-bind` object syntax on a _native element_ like `
` 2. Give the object a camelCase property 3. Inspect the element to see that the attribute converts to lowercase, not kebab-case ### What is expected? It should convert the camelCase property to a kebab-case attribute: `
` ### What is actually happening? It converts the camelCase to lowercase instead, with no hyphen: `
` --- Why is this an issue? It causes a problem when using scoped slots with slot props. Slots automatically create a slot props object for bindings which converts (correctly) any kebab-case properties to camelCase. But if you then `v-bind` the slot props to a native element, like `
`, i.e. spreading the props back to attributes to reverse the conversion, it strips the hyphen. For example, ``. The attribute gets converted (correctly) to camelCase in the resulting slotProps object: `{ ariaHaspopup: true }`. Then if you `
` in the parent slotted content, expecting it to de-convert the slot prop from camelCase back to kebab-case, it actually only converts it to lowercase instead: `
`, with no hyphen. Here is a demo of that: https://jsfiddle.net/sh0ber/wavLkd9f/ Notice the button's attribute is missing a hyphen.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "camelCase properties are not converted to kebab-case when using `v-bind="{ }"` object syntax on a native element" (#11913)

Issues.Title: IDE, Authoring Tool, Marketing
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Hi guys. Has anybody noticed this thing called Framer.com using React? Pardon the external link https://youtu.be/hAPxeoP8wn8. Don't get me wrong. I love Vue. What I'm suggesting is for the Vue community to create a similar app in partnership with Adobe for Adobe Animate.

### What does the proposed API look like?
I'm hoping Vue to leverage marketing through Adobe because of its famous experience in creating fluid authoring IDE. However Adobe converts those organic animations to the web via HTML Canvas reducing its responsiveness and SEO features. Vue can take leverage of that approach.

Of couse Adobe has its issues with Open Source but it would be very nice to have a PR genius to solve that roadblock!

Issues.Body:

Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No
- [x] Not sure if this is considered a breaking change 

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:


**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

**Other information:**
Look at this codeexample:
```ts
import { AsyncComponent, Component } from 'vue'
const a: AsyncComponent = () => ({
  component: new Promise<Component>((res, rej) => {
    res({})
  }),
})

const b: AsyncComponent = () => ({
  component: () =>
    new Promise<Component>((res, rej) => {
      res({})
    }),
})
```

The first example is like in the docs https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-dynamic-async.html#Handling-Loading-State and the second example should not work (I also looked at the implementation and I think this would not work).

The types are currently like such that the first example throws a type Error and the second throws no error. This PR fixes that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(types): async Component types" (#11906)

Issues.Title: [Feaure Request] Reload component when navigating among pages rendered by a same component
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Suppose there is a route:
```
{
      path: '/user/:id',
      name: 'userHome',
      component: () => import('./views/user/Home'),
      props: true
    },
```
When navigating from page '/user/1' to page '/user/2', the page is not updated for the rendering component is the same and vue router will not reload it.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Reload the component when any of the route's params changed.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feaure Request] Reload component when navigating among pages rendered by a same component" (#3479)

Issues.Title: android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页，打开页面后，不能回退到首页。同样的代码，浏览器中正常
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle/无](http://jsfiddle/无)







### Steps to reproduce
1、android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页index.html，router采用hash模式；
2、在首页index.html的created函数中，使用router.push打开一个页面A，OK；
3、在A中，点击按钮后，使用router.push打开一个页面B，在B中点击按钮，调用router.back或go(-1)，无法返回，提示Not allowed to navigate top frame to data URL: data:text/html;charset=utf-8;charset=utf-8;base64,#/；
4、如果使用history模式，返回后呈现空白页。
试过再加一重跳转，index.html->A->B->C，都无法返回，日志提示是一样的。
### What is expected?
返回页面A

### What is actually happening?
页面无变化，日志中提示Not allowed to navigate top frame to data URL: data:text/html;charset=utf-8;charset=utf-8;base64,#/；
source: http://app.njhx.com/assets/builtin/vue-router-src_3.5.1.js (1994)
应该是这一行，window.location[replace ? 'replace' : 'assign'](url);

---
我猜测可能因为loadDataWithBaseURL，index.html是data url，所以不能返回，
但是进入index.html后，就立刻router.push(A)了，按理在B中调用router.back()时，应该回到A才对。

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页，打开页面后，不能回退到首页。同样的代码，浏览器中正常" (#3471)

Issues.Title: Add 'active' and 'exact-active' events to ( router-link ) component
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I want to change position of ( link pointer ) to position of exact match link element 
```vue
<template lang="pug">
    div.menu
        Logo.menu__logo( :full='true' )
        ul.menu__list
          template( v-for='(path, localeKey) in links' )
            li.menu__item( @mouseleave='hoverdLink = null' @mouseover='hoverdLink = $event.target' )
              router-link.menu__link( :to=' `#${path.slice(1)}` ' ) {{ $t(`links.${localeKey}`) }}
          span.menu__pointer( ref='pointer' )
</template>
<script>
export default {
  data () {
    return {
      hoverdLink: null,
      activeLink: null,
      links: { ... }
    }
  },
  watch: {
    hoverdLink (hoverdLink) {
      const setWidth = (width) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.width = width + 'px' }
      const setPosition = (position) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.left = position + 'px' }
      if (!hoverdLink) {
        setWidth(0)
      } else {
        setWidth(hoverdLink.getBoundingClientRect().width)
        setPosition(hoverdLink.offsetLeft)
      }
    }
  }
}
</script>
```

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->

### Describe the solution you'd like
So i want to add an listener to 'active' event or 'exact-active' event to make it
```vue
<template lang="pug">
    div.menu
        Logo.menu__logo( :full='true' )
        ul.menu__list
          template( v-for='(path, localeKey) in links' )
            li.menu__item( @mouseleave='hoverdLink = null' @mouseover='hoverdLink = $event.target' )
              router-link.menu__link( :to=' `#${path.slice(1)}` '  @exact-active='activeLink = $event.target' ) {{ $t(`links.${localeKey}`) }}
          span.menu__pointer( ref='pointer' :class='{ "menu__pointer--active" : !!activeLink }' )
</template>
<script>
export default {
  data () {
    return {
      hoverdLink: null,
      activeLink: null,
      links: { ... }
    }
  },
 watch: {
    hoverdLink (hoverdLink) {
      // don't move pointer
      if ( this.activeLink ) return
      const setWidth = (width) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.width = width + 'px' }
      const setPosition = (position) => { this.$refs.pointer.style.left = position + 'px' }
      if (!hoverdLink) {
        setWidth(0)
      } else {
        setWidth(hoverdLink.getBoundingClientRect().width)
        setPosition(hoverdLink.offsetLeft)
      }
    }
  }
}
</script>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add 'active' and 'exact-active' events to ( router-link ) component" (#3468)

Issues.Title: v-router warning about using v-slot
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/commit/d2cb951#diff-d69779a774d18aab6696dcf281454982a329104177c1a5f885089da9fefefd94R134-R148](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/commit/d2cb951#diff-d69779a774d18aab6696dcf281454982a329104177c1a5f885089da9fefefd94R134-R148)







### Steps to reproduce
See the conditions for firing the warning:

https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/commit/d2cb951#diff-d69779a774d18aab6696dcf281454982a329104177c1a5f885089da9fefefd94R134-R148

### What is expected?
You should only get the warning about using v-slot if you are actually using `tag` or `event` props

### What is actually happening?
Since `tag` and `event` have non-falsey default values, the warning will always fire with any use of router-link.

---
Perhaps you should just compare if the values for `tag` or `event` are non-default and fire the warning, even though this doesn't cover the edge case that `tag` or `event` are actually being passed in with a value that matches the default.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: New feature: Data Store(before PR)
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve? [#3445: vue-router positionStore memory leak](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/3445) #### reconstruct `util/state-key` used `window.performance.now()` as the state key will reset when localtion reload, It may conflict with other hisotories ### What does the proposed API look like? ### router.setData(key, data) - `key` ___string___ - `data` ___any___ ### router.getData(key) - `key` ___string___ - Returns: ___any___ ### router.removeData(key) - `key` ___string___ ### Online Demo: https://hezedu.github.io/SomethingBoring/vue-router-positionstore-memory-leak/pr-demo.html#/ ## Why adding these new features? Unlike [window.history](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History), vue-router has no API to change history.state. But sometimes we need it to store some unique keys, like the `positionStore`.
So I replaced `positionStore` with `dataStore`. This way you can store more things.
And there is no need to develop `state` related APIs in the future.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "New feature: Data Store(before PR)" (#3452)

Issues.Title: Detect `popstate` vs `push`/`replace` in navigation guards
Issues.Body:
It would be useful to detect if navigation comes from interaction within the app (`router.push()`) or outside of it (`history.back()`).

The API is still to be decided and should be the same on v4 and v3, probably something inside of the `to` parameter of navigation guards

```js
router.beforeEach((to, from, next) => {
  to.navigation.type // 'pop' | 'push'
  to.replace // true | false
  to.navigation.direction // number
```

Related #1620
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Detect `popstate` vs `push`/`replace` in navigation guards" (#3453)

Issues.Title: Private Mutations
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I am faced with the problem that I have a change in state that might cause that state to become inconsistent. Let's say I have a city name and a zip code in my state. I do not want to change the zip code if the city is not within the area of that zip code. If I do that in a mutation I have no way to reject that change or to catch an error. However if I do it in an action I still need a mutation since actions cannot modify the state directly. Now my colleague is new to our huge project and doesn't notice that one must use the action instead of the mutation and causes the state to become inconsistent. Hence I propose mutations that may only be called from an action. This would enable developers to restrict changes in state to only non-breaking changes.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Since I use TypeScript the obvious way to do it seems a decorator. However to maintain consistency with the api and to be pure js compatible one might introduce a whole different category (e.g. "setters"). If backward compatibility were not an issue this may also become the default behavior as use-cases for mutations directly in components are rare anyhow, since most data needs validation. 
![Infographic from the official documentation](https://vuex.vuejs.org/vuex.png)

This infographic at  seems to imply this also. However these are just proposals off the top of my head and any implementation would need careful consideration as they would deeply impact the vuex api.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Expose storeKey for unit test mocking when using useStore
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
When unit testing Composition API style components, the developer may want to mock the Vuex store for testing purposes. However, due to the Vue instance not being available at setup() time, the useStore method is used in place of this.$store. This requires the developer to inject their Vuex mock, rather than using the traditional instance mocking option of the vue-test-utils mount function. Provide/inject requires a key, which, unlike $store, is not visible to the end user.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Export the default storeKey. For devs who use the default storeKey rather than providing a custom key on plugin installation, this will provide a more durable testing solution. While the key is currently the string "store", this could change in the future, leaving end users with unexpected failing tests. Vue-router has similarly exported their provide keys. I'm willing to create a PR for this.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Immutable references state properties should NOT warn of `do not mutate vuex store state outside mutation handlers.`
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
In a lot of contexts, we want to store _reference_ of objects in the store that come from a _library_. 
This means that the reference come from _outside_ the store and is managed (mutated) outside of the store too.

Vuex will by default, rightfully throw a warning because the object is mutated oustide of the store mutations.
However in some cases it is useful to store such references in the stores as _immutable references_, in order to persists them and to use them through getters and actions.
The warning should _not_ be thrown IF and only IF the reference is Immutable. The only known way of ensuring this is to wrap the reference with this Type: 
```Typescript
type Immutable<T> = {
  readonly [K in keyof T]: Immutable<T[K]>;
};
```

for example the state could have a [tiptap](https://github.com/ueberdosis/tiptap) Editor reference:
```Typescript 
editor!: Immutable<Editor> = getTipTapEditorInstance();
```

Where the Editor properties setting is managed by the library.
Which is a much needed pattern.


### What does the proposed API look like?
Vuex needs either to propose an Annotation that we would put above the immutable reference declaration in order to silence the warning *just* for this reference.
OR to detect at runtime to not throw the warning if all keys of the object are immutable/const
OR to detect if the reference is wrapped by the type Immutable<T>, type which could be provided by Vuex or even Vue.ts because it is generally useful

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Best Practice: Should we throw errors in getters if the state is undefined?
Issues.Body:
Quite often we are handling situations that require an optional state. 

E.g., my state might look like this

```
export type State = {
  isAuthenticated: boolean
  account?: Account
}
```

The initial state will always be initialized with `isAuthenticated: false`. However, we assume that account will always be set in case a user logs in to our system. The user gets fetched during the login process.

At the moment, we are writing getters in a very simple an lean way, e.G.

```
  getAccount(state: State): Account | undefined
```

However, this approach would require us to either check if the return value of getAccount is `Account` or `undefined` in our consuming components, or we would need to use type assertion ( `const account = store.getters.getAccount as Account` ) which I think is a very bad practice.

My current approach would validate inside the getter if  the state is set and throw an error if it isn't, e.g.:

```
getAccount: (state) => {
  if(!state.account) {
    throw new Error("Account isn't set")
  }
  return state.account
}
```

Which would enable me to globally catch errors that occurre in getters rather than handling it in every single component.

What are the best practices of handling optional state in getters? Am I going down the wrong path?

Thank you
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Best Practice: Should we throw errors in getters if the state is undefined? " (#1923)
